meanings.definition: A person or thing competing with another for the same objective or for superiority in the same field of activity.
meanings.sent1: In the race, my biggest rival was Tom.
meanings.sent2: The two companies are rivals in the market.
meanings.sent3: The rival squirrel tried to steal the nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her rival in chess always made strategic moves.
meanings.sent5: The rival team's determination was unmatched.

meanings.definition: To be or seem to be equal or comparable to.
meanings.sent1: His skills rival those of a professional chef.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant aims to rival the popular ones in town.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to rival the dog's speed but failed.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset could not be rivaled.
meanings.sent5: The student's artwork rivaled that of the famous painter.
